adjective.description: Directly opposed or contrasted; mutually incompatible.
examples: people whose religious beliefs are antithetical to mine
two antithetical emotions pulled at her

adjective.description: Connected with, containing, or using the rhetorical device of antithesis.

origin: Late 16th century (in antithetical (sense 2)): from Greek antithetikos, from antithetos placed in opposition, from antitithenai set against.
